**The Purple Sphere Elixir Canon**

*The Purple Sphere Perfected One states:*
The Dao of inner elixir lies within the breath of one’s own body—the root of spirit and qi, the valley of emptiness—below the heart and above the navel. At the outset, all licentious and wayward thoughts must cease; one returns illumination to the Central Palace. Day and night, one remains as if sleepless, the primordial yang unspent. Naturally, fire arises from the kidneys and ascends to pay homage to the heart, where true yang unites with the Central Palace—this is the union of heart and kidneys. After a hundred days of practice, the elixir head coalesces. The Three Palaces ascend and descend, the River Chariot revolves, qi resounds within the abdomen, wind stirs in the Mud Pill Palace, and fire blazes in the Cinnabar Field, suffusing the body with harmony.

Should one fail to maintain vigilance for even an hour or neglect seated practice for a single night, the medicinal essence will dissipate, the fire timing falter, and all prior effort be forfeit. This is a Dao easily encountered yet difficult to perfect.

As *The Awakening to Reality* says: *"To cultivate but a single element is to wander in exhaustion!"* Thus, though thousands or tens of thousands study, scarcely one or two ever succeed. Years pass in vain, and with hoary hair, they sigh in bewilderment. Yet the fault lies not in the practice itself, but in men’s yang being external and their yin internal, their natures prone to flight and restlessness, unable to refine and restrain.

*Master Nameless says:* Essence, qi, and spirit are the great foundation of the body. Alas, this substance is the utmost yin of posterior heaven—without the true yang elixir of prior heaven to transmute one’s own yin mercury, how can it congeal and transform? This is a Dao difficult to encounter yet easy to perfect.

Regard body and mind as Kan and Li, man and woman as dragon and tiger. When the knife and spatula enter the mouth, once mercury is obtained, it gathers without scattering, and the more it is refined, the firmer it becomes. With the return of wind and the blending of chaos, within a hundred days, one attains spiritual communion. Though a fool or simpleton, through this practice, one instantly transcends to the rank of sages.

*Ma Ziran says:* *"To speak of beginning at the hour of Chou brings laughter that cannot be stilled. Yet this very thing is the returning elixir, though it often leads men astray under heaven."*

The *Most High* says: *"When inferior men hear the Dao, they laugh greatly. If they did not laugh, it would not be the Dao."*

As *The Awakening to Reality* states: *"The effort is easy, the medicine not distant—revealed, it makes men burst into laughter."* Such is the wondrous principle of the outer elixir.

The Dao of the inner elixir lies in the absence of a single arising thought, in silent inner vigilance, in unwavering constancy day and night. Those of strong will, men of iron spines, through long stillness achieve success. They may project spirit and shed the body, coming and going freely—these are the immortals. Yet among thousands or tens of thousands of modern scholars, scarcely one or two attain this, for it is a Dao easily encountered yet difficult to perfect.

If one cultivates both inner and outer elixirs, refining both nature and life, one must first enter seclusion and sit in stillness, clearly recognizing the Central Palace as the dwelling of body and life. Day and night without sleep, the mind guards within, the heart and kidneys unite in union, and the five qi gather in the Central Palace. After a hundred days of purity, the chaotic elixir head forms, resembling a parrot’s egg—lively and fluid, gathering and dispersing, ascending and descending. It is easily dissipated and difficult to congeal.

Thereafter, one extracts the single point from Kan, the true unity of pure yang elixir, to transmute the yin mercury elixir head within Li, instantly transforming it into a body of pure Qian. Thus, once obtained, it is eternally retained, gathering without scattering. Success is achieved in days, with both form and spirit perfected. There is no need to project spirit or shed the body—one may pierce metal and penetrate stone, perform a thousand transformations and ten thousand changes. Then, sitting in stillness for nine years, one awakens to the nature school, attaining the Dao of heavenly immortals.

**Secret Formula of the Golden Elixir**

The *Book of Changes* says: *"The six hours from Zi to Si form half a celestial cycle."* To perform this most wondrous practice, one moves this water and conducts this fire, also taking baths and ablutions. The count is six days, corresponding to three months. Altogether, the movement of water spans from Wu to Hai, six hours in number.

From Zi to Si, one conducts fire weighing one jin, one liang, and one zhu—twenty-four zhu make one liang, which is one breath. Water is metal-water, also called the wine within the pot. When drawing from the water tripod, it is at the twenty-fourth Si, within the six-hour celestial count. Only two hours are spent in this movement, also within the celestial count, but one must not proceed past Zi. If the hour is misaligned, the medicine will lack efficacy.

If one conducts water and fire in accordance with the hours, harmonizing with the utmost wonder of heaven and earth, not a single thing will go amiss. This fire timing is a secret formula of the highest immortals—it must not be treated lightly! To transmit it to the unworthy invites heavenly retribution.

*Zhang the Perfected One says:* *"Meeting someone yet not transmitting the secret celestial treasure, or transmitting it to the unworthy, is to leak the heavenly Dao. When transmitting, one must ensure the recipient is genuine; reckless transmission brings karmic punishment to seven generations."*

To those without faith, even if surrounded by gold and jade, do not impart this. Moreover, to transmit this Dao, one must preserve essence and nurture qi, accumulate virtuous deeds to save others, honor parents, revere heaven and earth, and repay the king and the land. Thus, success is achieved in days, and one stands shoulder to shoulder with the ancient sages. If one acts recklessly or lightly, dust and obstacles arise, and success is unattainable. But by following this wondrous Dao, ascending to the golden towers of heaven—how could it be difficult?

Through this Dao dwelling within me, I rescue and uplift seven generations of ancestors. The Dao is originally formless, giving birth to heaven and earth; it is originally nameless, and we forcibly call it the Dao. One must reverently guard this secret, for in every place, divine dragons offer protection.

*Zhang the Perfected One says:* *"Transmitting thrice to the unworthy brings three great calamities. If one treats it lightly or leaks it, one will fall into the suffering of Dengdu. Later, those of like mind and love for the Dao should guide one another, that the multitudes may avoid premature death."*

My fate is not decreed by Heaven. The *Luyanzi Secret Formula for Refining and Nurturing* by Yu Shouyi of Western Shu—this formula was already revered as the profound root by the divine immortals of high antiquity. Receive it with reverence and treasure it, that primordial yang may be deeply stored within the Purple Palace, and true essence may ascend to the Original Palace. The key lies in seizing the moment to apply or withdraw, and in fortifying the Seven Gates and sealing the Eight Deviations—truly the essential Dao. If treated lightly or leaked, one will incur the retribution of yin. This is the twenty-eighth transmission of the Purple Radiance Perfected One!

**Ancient Immortal’s Secret Formula**
- Black Dragon’s spine and brain: 24 taels, soaked in fine rice vinegar, then roasted until scorched red and ground to powder.
- Sal ammoniac: half a tael.
- Fennel: half a tael.
- Sour jujube kernels: half a tael, stir-fried and shelled.
- Magnetite: one tael, calcined in fire and quenched in vinegar seven times.
- Stone swallows: three, prepared identically.
- Pumice: two taels, prepared identically.
- Walnut meat: half a tael, stir-fried.
- Lotus seeds: one tael.
- Morinda root: one tael, stir-fried.
- Foxnut seeds: one tael.
- Polygala root: one tael, with hearts removed.
- Cistanche: one tael, soaked in wine.
- Acorus: one tael.

Grind the above into powder. Take twenty-one yellow sparrows, remove their beaks, wings, feathers, feet, and entrails, then boil them in fine wine until pulpy. Discard the bones and mix with the powder to form pills the size of tung seeds. Take thirty pills on an empty stomach, washed down with musk wine. At the critical moment, one may feel as though drawing water through a tube, or like insects crawling from below upward, with heat blazing like fire—this is the sign of efficacy. After five to seven days of ingestion, a natural response will follow. Take again at the appointed time; the formula powerfully seals the essence-chamber, replenishes primordial yang, and when closed, true essence ascends to the Mud Pill Palace, coalescing into a treasure!

The Dao of cultivation and refinement does not depart from the Five Phases and the union of yin and yang. Just as Heaven and Earth do not unite, the myriad things cannot arise; just as the sun and moon do not unite, the waxing, waning, crescents, and fullness of the lunar phases cannot be distinguished.

When husband and wife do not unite, men and women cannot nurture and raise offspring. Only through harmonious union do they remain mortal; through reversed union do they attain sagehood. Master Zhang the Perfected says: "When the woman dons blue robes and the gentleman wears plain white silk, though seen, they must not be used; though used, they must not be seen." If husband and wife meet in union, affection naturally lingers. Within the crucible, flames take flight, and the Perfected One emerges of itself.

Master Lü the Perfected says: "Let spirit unite while body does not; allow inner release while outer remains sealed." The High Perfected says: "Union has its time; gathering has its day. Gather and take with utmost care." Master Zhang the Perfected says: "I urge you to gather in accord with the seasons."

Moreover, the Western Florescence Perfected, in discoursing on the method of longevity, directly points to the true principle of lead and mercury, fearing that世人 might mistake seminal essence and fluids for lead and mercury, or heart and kidneys for Kan and Li, abandon their wives, cease eating grain, retreat into mountain forests, emulate pines and consume cypress, chant mantras and drink water, recite scriptures and swallow elixirs—all losing the source of the True One. To hope for the completion of the Reverted Elixir thus would be like netting rabbits in water, seeking fish in green wood, or drawing cakes to allay hunger—all vain efforts.

They know not that the True Dragon is the sun, Heaven, mercury, the soul of wood, the male—what the sages cryptically call the Azure Dragon. The True Tiger is the moon, Earth, metal, lead, the spirit, the female—what the sages cryptically call the White Tiger. Therefore, true lead is that which has not yet been tempered by the Azure Dragon. It flourishes most in the flowering season of the gui year, and must be gathered with the Azure Dragon Sword—then there will be no error. "One mouthful of the Flying Spirit Sword, two horns of the Reverted Elixir—all rests upon where the blade’s edge falls. Without the guidance of an enlightened master, countless kalpas of cultivation will be in vain."

Masters Zhang and Lü the Perfected also say: "Gather the heart of the flower, the medicine of the flower—layer upon layer of radiant beauty. Pluck the spring blossoms with their stems, drink the wine of jade nectar. At this moment, the Dao begins to sprout." The worldly do not fathom the principle within the flower; one decision of celestial mechanism is worth ten thousand gold.

Thus, the yin essence of man cannot congeal without true lead; it must rely on the union of lead and mercury to return to the man’s original palace, forming a single round pearl. After ten months of fulfillment, the embryo is transformed through spiritual transmutation.

Master Ziyang says: "When frost flies in the tenth month, the elixir is ripe—even spirits and ghosts must marvel." A single grain of the knife’s measure, born within the chamber, grows as large as a pomegranate seed, its color fresh as amber. Only one grain of this elixir may be taken; if the fire is too great, cease.

Master Lü the Perfected says: "A grain of the knife’s measure determines longevity; true lead must refine jia and geng. Fire is drawn from the crimson phoenix marrow of the south; water from the black turtle essence of the north." He also says: "Swallowing one grain of the Golden Elixir, you will know at last that my fate is not ruled by Heaven."

After ingesting the elixir, all depends on the regimen of fire and nurturing, the method of withdrawal and addition—never departing from the Recumbent Moon Crucible. He also says: "There is a natural true fire regimen; no need for kindling or blowing." And: "Within the Recumbent Moon Crucible, the jade medicine is born; within the cinnabar tripod, mercury lies level. Only after the fire’s power is harmonized does the yellow sprout gradually grow."

The foregoing songs and verses contain the secret formulas of the true immortals. Cultivate according to this method, and you will surely ascend to the rank of immortality. Those of like mind and devotion to the Dao who come after, having obtained this, must keep it secret and not lightly disclose it. Hold it in reverence! Exercise caution!

The *Purple Cluster Elixir Canon* concludes. #1 (Note: "也" should be corrected to "他".)

**Preface to the Recumbent Moon Mysterious Gold Chapter**

Before the Dao divided, it could not be illuminated or perceived. Invisible to sight, inaudible to hearing, it was called the "dim and obscure"—the formless Dao. After the Dao had separated, the Great Beginning arose; the Five Phases were distinguished, the Two Modes established. The sun and moon became the hun and po, circulating the Five Phases between heaven and earth, arraying yin and yang as qi and seasons, ascending and descending within the cosmos. The pestle and mortar stars appear at the southern and northern sources, forming the hexagrams of Qian and Kun, converging between Xu and Hai. Through the waxing and waning of the sun and moon, yin and yang unite in harmony, and thereafter the myriad things are born. All things receive their endowment at Hai, emerging from non-being, and germinate at Ren and Zi. Humans, born alongside the myriad things, all issue forth from the gateways of heaven and earth. Qian is the gate of heaven; Kun is the door of earth. As Bo Yang said: "Qian and Kun are the gateways of the *Yi*." In human birth, the Dao of Qian forms the male, the Dao of Kun forms the female; the two emotions interact and receive their qi. Yang essence becomes the hun, yin essence becomes the po; when the two essences contend, spirit is born.

Thus, the sage seizes the transformative mechanism of Qian and Kun, harmonizes the essences of male and female, yin and yang, unites the hun and po of the sun and moon’s transformations, and gathers the correspondences of the Five Phases and Three Origins. Thereby, the single qi merges with the Two Modes, the Three Powers are complete, and the Four Images are communicated. Nurtured within the divine chamber’s earthen crucible, once the Five Phases are fully present, the elixir naturally forms. The sages of antiquity and the immortals of recent ages all ascended to heaven by refining the golden elixir.

**First: Refining and Nurturing the Golden Elixir in the Divine Chamber**

To refine the golden elixir, one must rely on the qi of Qian and Kun, mutually restraining and subduing each other, congealing to form the Great Elixir. The true mercury of men naturally yearns for lead; though temporarily retained, it soars when exposed to fire, making it difficult to subdue. Only when red lead is obtained to temper its nature—even if dispersed—can white silver then gather it, causing it to congeal without scattering. Thereafter, it is refined in the Recumbent Moon Mysterious Gold Crucible, irrigated with red snow and jade cream, bathed in golden water, and after ninety days, the yang elixir is achieved. As Immortal Bao said: "Refine the head in the eighth month, the tail in winter." Gao Xiangxian said: "Great indeed! After ninety days, the work is complete and verification possible!" After ninety days of refining, the qi returns, transforming entirely into pure yang. As Zhang Langxian said: "The golden crow sets, the jade hare rises." Gao Xiangxian said: "All things are born of heaven and earth." Once the body of pure yang is achieved, one then selects the golden elixir that has formed, ingests a single grain, and ascension to heaven is assured! Having obtained the sage’s profound secrets, though the elixir canons number a hundred thousand words, one glance suffices for comprehension—what is meant by "mastering one method completes all things." The Dao is not distant!

**Second: Gathering Red Snow to Refine the Yang Elixir**

Only by collecting red snow and refining it into white silver does the true essence stabilize and the original yang begin to coalesce. The refined yang elixir becomes the foundation of life, forming the mysterious pearl as the root of longevity. Thereafter, essence flourishes in the cinnabar field, where the original qi resides, circulating through the blood vessels. As Pingshu said: "The golden crucible seeks to retain mercury within the pearl; the jade pool first receives silver from the water." Red snow is produced within the golden crucible’s moonlight, known as "gold within water," which the sages name the supreme treasure. As Hai Chan said: "Refining yields a sufficiency of yang elixir." Pingshu said: "Such a supreme treasure exists in every household." The green crucible’s qi and blood sea—termed the "confluence of the four seas," also called the "water source"—its meridians are likened to tidal seas, their arrival predictable, hence also called "trustworthy water." Its color is red, called "red water" or "descending qi," also known as "black lead," which generates spirit and engenders transformation, thus called "divine water." Sharing the same meridian as the Greater Yin, it cycles through thirty days, beginning anew, with two crescents and the new and full moons spanning five days. Water and metal generate the woman’s "trustworthy water," arriving five times in a month. Mercury born in water and gold sinks and is turbid; after three days, it floats and becomes clear. The clear is the medicine; the turbid is black lead. As Immortal Yin said: "Black lead has encountered gathered red lead." As Master Lü said: "Discern the clarity and turbidity of the water source, then know the separation between metal and wood." Pingshu said: "Without recognizing floating and sinking, host and guest are undetermined." This is the proof. After three days, on the fourth and fifth days, gather the floating and clear substance—red lead, also called red snow, water-gold, or white silver. White silver is produced from black lead. The *Cantong Qi* states: "Lead’s nature is to float; silver’s nature is to sink." The formula says: At midnight, the hour of Zi, a rosy glow naturally illuminates the crucible’s surface, filling the chamber with light. The lead, containing the five colors, radiates brilliance externally, and the light shines of itself. As Hai Chan said: "Turning the head to follow the cycle, a rosy glow fills the chamber." Master Lü said: "The warm lead crucible’s light penetrates the curtains." The Purple Cluster Immortal said: "When the crucible’s light and qi are replete, this is the moment to gather the medicine. Choose a master to verify the method, follow the daily practice, and the medicine will surely form!"

**Third: Gathering the Yin-Yang True Elixir**

To gather the elixir medicine, one must skillfully turn the heavenly pivot and earthly axle, inverting above and below, employing the intent of the tortoise drinking, so that the gathered medicine directly enters the Crimson Palace, ascending to the Mud Pill Palace, where it transforms into the mysterious pearl. The *Yinfu Jing* states: "When heaven unleashes its killing mechanism, dragons and serpents rise on land; when humans unleash their killing mechanism, heaven and earth overturn." This is what is meant.

Sea Toad said: "At this time, the crucible rests in the east (甲乙), the furnace aligns with the west (庚辛); turning the heavenly pivot, the Jade Balance halts its mechanism; rolling the earthly axle, the six lines transform as one. The muddy pearl appears before the twin trees, borne across the Celestial Bridge. The Gate of the Mysterious Female opens, and within the Flowery Pond, the true dragon returns to receive it.

Once, the Yellow Emperor roamed Red City and obtained the mysterious pearl. Li Ming sought it in vain—this Dao cannot be seized by sight. Later, he sent Wang Xiang to search, and it was found, for when profit is utterly cut off and nothing is seen, the mysterious pearl emerges in the midst of dim obscurity. Gao Xiangxian said: 'The mysterious pearl flies to Kunlun’s summit—if you would obtain it, seek Wang Xiang.'

The true essence of man is called the Great Yang Flowing Pearl; the descending qi of woman is called the Great Yin Mysterious Pearl. If it flees and cannot be restrained—like mercury meeting great fire, instantly vaporizing and flying away—only when bound by silver does it settle and congeal, as mercury meeting silver becomes cinnabar. Nurtured by fire, it transforms and blooms into golden flowers. The Yin Immortal Lord said: 'Golden flowers give birth to heaven and earth’s treasure'—this is what is meant.

To gather the red lead medicine is called 'transmitting the elixir,' for it is the transmission of red snow. Whether entering the Crimson Palace or passing through the Three Passes to ascend directly to the Mud Pill Palace, since ancient times, immortals and sages have passed this down mouth to mouth, never committing it to paper.

**Fourth: The Verification Formula for the Returned Elixir**

For those who study the Dao, first recognize the returned elixir, and you will surely become an immortal! The *Profound Principles Sutra* states: 'Only fear the lead is not true—if the lead is true, the medicine forms itself; only fear the mercury is not upright—if the mercury is upright, the medicine must be sacred.' It also says: 'There is a day for gathering, a time for taking—people use it yet do not know.'

Pingshu said: 'On the fifteenth of the eighth month, admire the toad’s radiance—this is precisely when the golden essence flourishes. The golden essence is the golden elixir; once obtained, success can be achieved in days.' Before completion, merely ingesting a single grain can instantly transmute the yin qi within the body, transforming it entirely into pure yang to become a divine immortal.

Thus, woman is the image of the Kan trigram, and within Kan lies one yang, called the Kan male—like the rabbit in the moon. Man is the Li trigram, containing one yin line, called the Li female—like the crow in the sun. Pingshu said: 'Take the solid center from the Kan position, transmute the yin within the Li palace. If you obtain the golden elixir medicine, after ingestion, you will traverse a thousand springs.' He also said: 'A single grain of knife-round divides into five colors, the flying elixir enters the immortal’s grotto.'

Zhao Jiangzhen said: 'After the seven returns and nine reversions complete their work, merely consume one grain to reach the immortal’s home.' Pingshu said: 'Swallowing a single grain of golden elixir, I know my fate is no longer ruled by heaven.' Sea Toad said: 'A single grain of golden elixir is the medicine of longevity, the Dao of achieving true unity.'

The *Primal Chaos Sutra* states: 'When lead and mercury unite, immortality can be sought; when mercury and lead meet, the Dao is never unfulfilled.' Master Bao said: 'Cinnabar slowly becomes silver through nine revolutions—how many have been misled to their deaths!'

The returned elixir uses the true dragon and true tiger, true lead and true mercury, harmonizing them within the Palace of Mutual Resonance. Afterward, gather and ingest it according to the proper time and day—this is called the returned elixir.

Humans are the physical form transformed by the five aggregates, a temporary union of earth, water, fire, and wind, with qi as the root, spirit as the foundation, and essence as the base. Failing to awaken to the primal source, one remains deluded, losing original qi, damaging the fundamental essence, dissipating the supreme treasure, and thus failing to achieve the immortal Dao. Therefore, the sage clarifies the return, discerns ascent and descent, establishes host and guest, distinguishes lead and mercury, and illuminates the fire times—thus the Dao is surely accomplished!

The return is the beginning and end of the great elixir.

**Fifth: The Nine Returns and Seven Reversions—Matching and Harmonizing Categories**

The return is the return to the source, the reversion to the origin. If the great elixir is accomplished, it seizes heaven and earth’s creative power, condenses water and fire’s essence and spirit, cycles back and forth to gather the great medicine, and penetrates above and below to form the golden elixir.

Master True Unity said: 'The true yin elixir, water and fire, harmonize within a hundred days.' The Yin Immortal Lord said: 'This is the qi of Great Unity Yin.' Master Bao said: 'The Yellow Emperor, bowing to Guangchengzi, obtained the Dao of true unity.'

To refine the golden liquid returned elixir, first take the unused crucible, with the red lead within the body as the elixir’s head. Then take the used crucible, where the white silver within the body congeals into golden flowers, refining them into pure yang. Reintroduce it into the Palace of Mutual Resonance, within the Qian palace, and nurture the embryo for ten months until the qi is full. The process is complete after three cycles.

The *Supreme Hidden Sayings* begins: 'Beneath the beginning green, the moon and the sun...' The two characters 'beginning green' are incomprehensible to people. 'Beginning' refers to the female embryo; 'green' is the master of the elixir. The golden liquid returned elixir is the true lead of the alchemical maiden. It is also called fire lead, the true yang of the southern direction’s correct color. It is also called nine-revolved cinnabar, the Scarlet-Clad Immortal, the Radiant Golden Elixir, or the fire pear and burning jujube. It ripens in autumn, hence called autumn stone.

The *Primal Chaos Sutra* states: 'Red lead is the white tiger—first experience this joy. If one ingests it into the abdomen, it permeates the skin and flesh, harmonizing the four limbs. After three months, spiritual communication is achieved, and the great Dao is cultivated. When three thousand merits are fulfilled, lead congeals and mercury solidifies; water restrains fire and fire is subdued—then the supreme medicine is complete. Though the returned elixir’s work is accomplished and immortality is not yet achieved, one can attain longevity and avoid death!

The method requires the crucible to be perfectly prepared, the tiger and dragon free of all ailments before proceeding. It is crucial that the woman be under twenty-one, her menstrual water just cleared, and the mysterious pass not yet closed. At midnight, the hour of zi, when arousal occurs, ensure her spirit is joyful and qi harmonized. Then drive the green dragon to mate with the white tiger. After a moment, use the Seven-Star Sword to gather it, entering the original palace—thus the returned elixir will form in days."

The Mysterious Pearl and White Paste—when primordial qi flourishes, sinews and bones grow strong, no different from youth. Master Xu the Perfected says: "As the White Tiger just departs the Jade Grotto’s gate, the Crimson Dragon leaps from the True Pearl Sea." It fortifies primordial yang, like drinking nectar of jade—ancient immortals called it "Heavenly Wine," also "Crimson Wine," "Gold in Water," or "Golden Flower." This substance can congeal into pearls, a treasure of Heaven and Earth, hence called the Mysterious Pearl. If one ingests it, life endures as long as Heaven and Earth—thus it is also named the Queen Mother’s Immortal Peach, the Life-Restoring Elixir of Returned Soul, or the Purple Gold Elixir. Its sprout, born of true earth, is called the Yellow Sprout. The Yellow Sprout is the harmonious qi of Heaven and Earth, the Great Unity’s revolving convergence, where the Seven Luminaries and Nine Palaces gather and spirit coalesces—hence it is the root and stem of yin and yang.

Master Xiaoyao says: "Seize the golden essence to lay the foundation of life." Master Lü says: "Those who drank the *daogui* in that moment"—the method of elixir-gathering—later immortals named it *daogui* according to the times. Master Chuan the Perfected says:
*"A single grain of daogui,
Hidden beside the chambered maiden,
Large as a pomegranate seed,
Resplendent like fresh amber.
Gather it with utmost purity,
Harvest it with steadfast heart.
Swallow the age-extending medicine,
And your merit shall be recorded in Heaven."*

The elixir is obtained in an instant. Master Xiaoyao says: "The radiant golden elixir forms in a day." Master Pingshu says: "The elixir is complete within one *shichen*." The *daogui* lies outside the lower cinnabar field, within the Mysterious Gate, one *cun* and three *fen*. The elixir bears a crimson vein, ascending to the heart above and adhering to the small intestine below. When gathering it, one must concentrate the intent, draw it with an implement, and seize it in reverse—like capturing it alive to swallow whole. Master Zhongli says: "Tilt the jade gourd, and golden agate bursts forth—seize it alive and swallow it whole." It is also said: "Capture the tortoise and serpent, then reverse and inhale." The *Awakening the World Song* says: "Drive it to become the Crimson Dragon’s head, fiercely snatch the Black Pearl to absorb." The ancient sages said: "Before ingesting the golden elixir, first take the returned elixir—this is not amiss."

The *Scripture of the Great Ultimate* says: "Red lead and black mercury are the great elixir’s foundation." Lead is the true lead of the chaste maiden; black lead is the true lead of the woman. Taking the returned elixir before the golden elixir means introducing the red into the black. Thus, the two medicines together form the Mysterious, and the Fire Dragon transforms into a divine immortal.

The method of the returned elixir lies hidden within the Seven-Star Sword’s secrets; the oral instructions for its execution must be personally transmitted by a master. **Red Lead and Black Mercury as the Elixir’s Foundation, Sixth Chapter**

The method for refining the golden elixir and returned elixir is fully contained within the *Scripture of Primordial Chaos*. Yet one must also receive the true master’s oral instructions—without encountering a true master, cultivation is difficult to accomplish. The *Scripture of Primordial Chaos* says: "Before the primordial chaos divided, primordial qi was already distinct." Thus, one thing split into two images—these two images are yin and yang. Yang qi ascends to Heaven, yin qi descends to Earth, and between them, humans are born! From human birth, male and female diverge.

In refining the golden liquid and returned elixir, one must first gather the man’s mercury and woman’s lead, nurture them into an elixir, and recombine the two qi into one—just as before the primordial chaos divided. The *daogui* unites, and the returned elixir is thus formed. If one ingests a single grain, life endures as long as Heaven and Earth. Zhuangzi said: "Split the primordial chaos, rend the vast mist." The ancient sages said: "To forge the elixir, begin with two, then eight, then one." The method uses eight ounces each of lead and mercury, combining the two into one *jin*—forming the character for "elixir." Here, two and eight are yin; one is yang. From eighteen to twenty years of age, regulate them as the crucible and furnace, nurture them as the fire and timing.

The method requires waiting until the menstrual water has just cleared and the Mysterious Pass remains unsealed. The Green Dragon in the spirit chamber mates with the White Tiger, and yang essence enters the Dragon Palace—then the elixir forms and the embryo congeals. Nurture it for ten months, ensuring the elixir mother does not endure hardship; maintain a calm mind and peaceful body, and the elixir will surely form. After ten months, when the time arrives, the Purple River Chariot descends of its own accord. Seven days later, the elixir emerges from the upper palace on the left—retrieve it using the method of elixir extraction. First, bathe in fragrant water, ascend the altar, and pay homage to the Three Pure Ones, the Ten Loftiest Perfected, and the Perfected of the Great Unity. Afterward, ingest the elixir. The rituals are fully detailed in the lower scroll of the *Scripture of Primordial Chaos*, in the chapter titled "Dragon and Tiger."

Few in the world understand: after ingestion, bones are replaced and intestines transformed into sinews; spirit becomes clear, essence solidifies, yin qi dissipates entirely, and yang qi congeals into truth—thus one becomes a pure yang immortal. Master Lü was called the Perfected of Pure Yang. Master Zhao said: "Those who do not recognize the thing within yang refer to the One within the two and eight." The two and eight are the woman of eighteen, within whose body the true Way of the One is concealed. The One lies hidden within the Mysterious Pass—like a woman’s alignment with the Great Yin during her monthly cycle, completing one revolution of Heaven each month.

Thus, Master Yanluo said: "On the third day, when *geng* is born, the gate closes—metal is born of water. By the first quarter, half-bright; on the fifteenth and sixteenth days, the metal essence flourishes, and soul and spirit become whole." This alludes to the woman at fifteen or sixteen, when heavenly water arrives and yin essence flourishes. The world says: the first quarter on the seventh or eighth day, the last quarter on the twenty-second or twenty-third—from top to bottom, the number is fixed at sixteen. Master Bao said: "The eighteen-year-old maiden is even more tender." Master Pingshu said: "When the moon is but a half-wheel at the sky’s edge, the dragon’s roar and tiger’s howl are already heard. Then focus the mind to cultivate the two and eight—the elixir will form within one *shichen*." He also said: "Between the first and last quarters, the medicine’s flavor is balanced and its qi complete."

Returning from the search, the furnace refines within—
in quiet contemplation, gentle nurturing cooks the fresh elixir.
Harvest the cinnabar on the fifteenth night of the eighth month,
when the wind is clear and the moon radiant—
this is the time when metal essence flourishes in full vigor.
At midnight, the hour of *zi*, the first stirrings of yang arise.

Gao Xiangxian said:
There is a season for gathering, a day for harvesting—
gather and harvest with utmost care,
lest the black dragon awaken and startle,
heavenly truth be lost, and the dark pearl slip away.
There is a day for gathering, a season for harvesting—
yet the world uses them without knowing.

From ancient times, immortals and enlightened adepts
all attained perfection through refining and nurturing
the golden liquid returning cinnabar.
Fearing the leakage of heavenly secrets,
they veiled it under the name of "external elixir."
Later students, unaware, sought only external cinnabar,
burning lead and mercury in hopes of transcendence—
how far they strayed!

Gao Xiangxian said:
The world does not recognize true yin and yang,
wandering blindly in search of dragon and tiger.

Master Pingshu said:
Do not cling to the crucible and waste effort—
the elixir must be refined in the recumbent moon furnace.
The furnace is the vessel of the golden elixir,
yet later students mistakenly believe
the recumbent moon furnace, with its waxing and waning phases,
is the time to harvest the medicine—
a grave error indeed!

Gao Xiangxian said:
If only they could find the recumbent moon furnace,
I would not fear heavenly retribution,
and would reveal the essentials of elixir refinement
to enlighten later students.
**The Seventh Stage: Nurturing the Elixir’s Fire in the Recumbent Moon Furnace**

The secret of nurturing the elixir’s fire:
the furnace lies within the body’s Chamber of Union.
*The Scripture of Primordial Unity* states:
The White Tiger’s Original Palace is the realm of pure yang—
thus called the Palace of *Qian*.
It can contain the true qi of the Great One—
thus called the Palace of the Great One.

Herein silver is born, thus called the Cinnabar Pit.
Within the Jade Grotto, golden blossoms transform and arise—
thus called the Golden Chamber.
Where true earth abides,
it is called the Earth Cauldron, or the Gate of *Wu-Ji*.
The golden elixir is born here,
nurtured to achieve transmutation—
thus called the Spirit Chamber.
Its pool gives rise to water,
thus called the Flowery Pond,
or Spirit Water,
or the Gate of the Purple Palace.

Within this gate stand three mountains:
the left mountain is named *Jia* Mountain,
and within it lies a gate called the *Jia* Gate.
The right mountain is named *Ji* Mountain,
and within it lies a gate called the *Ji* Gate.
Between them rises a mountain called Purple Gold Mountain.
The Purple River Chariot emerges here—
the source of water.
The substances that issue from *Jia* Mountain and the *Jia* Gate
are called the Path of *Xi-Yi*,
the Path of the Three Blossoms,
the Path of White Snow,
and the Path of the Black Flight.
Those that issue from *Ji* Mountain and the *Ji* Gate
are called the Winding River Path,
the Path of the Five Colors,
and the Path of the Yellow Sprout.

Master Lü said:
Upon the Winding River, one beholds the moon’s radiant purity—
there, the Black Flight appears.
For *Jia* and *Ji* earth is true earth.
Master Pingshu said:
The four images converge within *Wu-Ji*.
Gao Xiangxian said:
Nothing surpasses first knocking at the Gate of *Wu-Ji*,
for the Spirit Chamber and Earth Cauldron are true earth.
When *Jia-Ji* true earth unites with the Spirit Chamber’s Earth Cauldron,
the two earths merge into a single *daogui*.

Yet世人 do not know that the woman’s Water Palace
follows the same course as the moon’s *Taiyin* radiance,
its measure also five days per phase.
Each month comprises six phases—
three *Jia* and three *Ji*.
On *Jia* days, the *Jia* Gate opens;
on *Ji* days, the *Ji* Gate opens;
on days of convergence, the Gate of the Purple Palace opens—
this is the faithful progression,
the five-day phase.

Gao Xiangxian said:
How wondrous!
Thirty spokes share one hub—
when Heaven and Earth engender transformation,
yin and yang intersect in fives and sixes.
Five denotes five days per phase;
six, six phases per month.
For those who refine the elixir,
the fire phases are most difficult.
Master Pingshu said:
Do not commit the fire phases to writing.
Master Qingxia said:
Within six hundred chapters lie boundless matters—
how could one lightly reveal celestial secrets?

In general, the fire phases occur within the six days of *Jia* and *Ji*,
at midnight, the hour of *zi*.
On *Jia* days, tilt the furnace to the right
to gather the qi from the left gate;
on *Ji* days, tilt the furnace to the left
to gather the qi from the right gate.
Since ancient times, immortals have treasured this secret,
neither disclosing this teaching
nor revealing this method—
merely naming it the Recumbent Moon Furnace.

Master Pingshu said:
Within the Recumbent Moon Furnace, jade buds arise.
In all methods of gentle nurturing,
the essential lies in guarding against danger and averting peril.
Master Lü said:
The work of advancing the fire is perilous as the Ox and Dipper.
Master Pingshu said:
In drawing and adding, be ever vigilant against danger.
*The Scripture of Yin Conformity* states:
Fire is born of wood,
and calamity inevitably follows—
beware this above all! Let this be your warning.

Just as the world has states, and each state has its ruler—civil governance to the left, martial authority to the right—when neighboring states invade, generals must be deployed to command the troops. The general receives the seal to take command, and the troops wield their weapons to act; the seal and weapons are the lifeblood of the army. With a general to lead the troops and orders issued, victory may be won in every battle. In warfare, the first strike is to sound the drum, and the highest merit lies in seizing the enemy’s banner. After victory, provisions overflow, and the River Chariot transports them straight into the Mud Pill Palace.

Once within the Mud Pill Palace, the Three Gates must be sealed: the upper gate to prevent the spirit from departing, the middle gate to keep the qi from scattering, and the lower gate to stop the essence from leaking—these are the Three Gates sealed. Once sealed, the work of transport begins, known as the "Flying Gold Essence behind the Elbow." As the Perfected One Xu said:
*At the Flowery Pond, the jade-like countenance drinks,
Flying past the Golden Pass, the face blooms like a lotus.*

When the golden essence passes the Three Passes and enters the Original Palace, the Golden Elixir is seen—no longer fleeing, it naturally submits. The seal is fire, and fire is the foundation of elixir refinement. In refining the Golden Elixir, fire timing is essential, just as a general with a seal commands troops without disorder. In applying fire timing, water and fire must not be misaligned; any error and the great work is lost. The Five Seals correspond to the Five Affairs; when the Five Affairs are correct, the heart remains unmoved, and when the heart is unmoved, the medicine does not flee. With the medicine unscattered, the Elixir is certain to form.

This text does not expound the Great Dao of the Golden Elixir. Never has there been one who attained immortality through the arts of the bedchamber—thus, this is preserved to warn against delusion, for it is not the true path of immortal cultivation.

*Preface to the "Recumbent Moon Mysterious Gold" Chapter #1*
*(Originally bound with the* Purple Ball Elixir Canon*, but should be separated according to the internal text.)*

chunks.original_text: 洞神部方法类 紫团丹经 经名：紫团丹经。 一卷，称紫团真人述，疑出於南宋时期。 底本出处：《正统道藏》洞神部方法类。 紫团丹经 紫团真人曰：内药之道，在乎自己身中呼吸之所，神气之根，虚无之谷，心之下，脐之上。 下手之初，淫邪尽罢，返照中宫，昼夜如不睡，元阳不漏，自然肾中火起，上朝於心，以真阳合於中宫，是为心肾交媾。 百日功夫，结成丹头，三宫升降，河车运转，腹中气响，泥丸风生，丹田火发，遍体冲和。 如有一时不守，一夜不坐，药财虚耗，火候亏缺，前功俱废，此名易遇而难成之道也。 《悟真篇》云：独修一物转赢廷矣！ 所以千人万人学，毕竟终无一二成者，经年虚度，皓首茫然，反起虚无之叹。 非修炼之过，实男子外阳而内阴，性好飞走，不能制炼。 无名子曰：精气神一身之大本，奈何此物乃后天至阴之物，不得也#1天真一阳丹点化自己阴汞，安能凝结以成变化。 此名难遇而易成之道也。 以身心为坎离，以男女为龙虎，刀圭入口，一得汞得，聚而不散，炼而愈坚，回风混合，百日通灵。 虽愚昧小人，行之立超圣位。 马自然曰：说下手於中丑，令人大笑不合口。 元来此物是还丹，往往交人天下走。 太上曰：下士闻道大笑之，不笑不足以为道。 《悟真篇》云：功夫容易药非遥，说破令人大失笑。 此外药至妙之理也。 内药之道，在乎一念不起，寂然内守，昼夜如一，有力量人，铁脊梁汉，久定成功，可以出神脱体，来去自由，谓之神仙。 今之学者千万人中，无一二可成者，乃易遇而难成之道也。 若内药外药，性命双修，先要入室静坐，明知中宫，安身立命之所，昼夜不睡，一心内守，身心肾交媾，五气聚於中宫，百日纯一，结成混沌丹头，状如鹦子，活泼泼地，一聚一散，升降往来，易为耗散，难得凝结。 然后却取坎中一点，真一纯阳之丹，点化自己离中阴汞丹头，立作纯乾之体，所以一得永得，聚而不散，指日成功，形神俱妙。 不必出神脱体，可以贯金透石，可以千变万化。 然后静坐九年，性宗自悟，是以天仙之道也。 金丹秘诀 《易》曰：子巳六时，分作半周天，至妙行此水，行此火，亦取浴沐，在数六日，当三月，都计行水，亦午至亥，六时行数也。 子巳六时，行火一斤一两一铢，二十四铢为一两，乃是一口也。 水者，金水也，又名壶中酒。 凡取水鼎，是二十四巳上，天在六时之数，只二时行了，亦在天时之数，只不得行过子。 若差时辰，则药无灵验矣！ 若便依时辰行水火，合天地至妙，万物无一失。 此火候乃上仙秘诀，不可轻矣！ 更与非人，返遭天谴。 张真人云：遇人不传秘天宝，传与非人泄天道。 传时须教传得真，妄传七祖受冥考。 若无信心之人，金玉堆裹不可与之。 且传此道，要保精养气，积行救人，孝顺父母，恭敬天地，报答国王水土。 如此指日成功，与古圣齐肩。 若妄意轻举，恐生尘障，不成。 若依此妙道，飞升金阙，岂为难哉！ 我身在道，救拔七祖超升。 道本无形，生育天地，道本无名，强名曰道。 切宜敬秘，在在处处，自有神龙护持。 张真人曰：三传非人，三遭大患，若轻慢泄漏，自身坠邓都之苦。 后有同志好道之士，宜互相引诱，使人庶无夭亡耳！

**The Purple Sphere Elixir Canon**

*The Purple Sphere Perfected One states:*
The Dao of inner elixir lies within the breath of one’s own body—the root of spirit and qi, the valley of emptiness—below the heart and above the navel. At the outset, all licentious and wayward thoughts must cease; one returns illumination to the Central Palace. Day and night, one remains as if sleepless, the primordial yang unspent. Naturally, fire arises from the kidneys and ascends to pay homage to the heart, where true yang unites with the Central Palace—this is the union of heart and kidneys. After a hundred days of practice, the elixir head coalesces. The Three Palaces ascend and descend, the River Chariot revolves, qi resounds within the abdomen, wind stirs in the Mud Pill Palace, and fire blazes in the Cinnabar Field, suffusing the body with harmony.

Should one fail to maintain vigilance for even an hour or neglect seated practice for a single night, the medicinal essence will dissipate, the fire timing falter, and all prior effort be forfeit. This is a Dao easily encountered yet difficult to perfect.

As *The Awakening to Reality* says: *"To cultivate but a single element is to wander in exhaustion!"* Thus, though thousands or tens of thousands study, scarcely one or two ever succeed. Years pass in vain, and with hoary hair, they sigh in bewilderment. Yet the fault lies not in the practice itself, but in men’s yang being external and their yin internal, their natures prone to flight and restlessness, unable to refine and restrain.

*Master Nameless says:* Essence, qi, and spirit are the great foundation of the body. Alas, this substance is the utmost yin of posterior heaven—without the true yang elixir of prior heaven to transmute one’s own yin mercury, how can it congeal and transform? This is a Dao difficult to encounter yet easy to perfect.

Regard body and mind as Kan and Li, man and woman as dragon and tiger. When the knife and spatula enter the mouth, once mercury is obtained, it gathers without scattering, and the more it is refined, the firmer it becomes. With the return of wind and the blending of chaos, within a hundred days, one attains spiritual communion. Though a fool or simpleton, through this practice, one instantly transcends to the rank of sages.

*Ma Ziran says:* *"To speak of beginning at the hour of Chou brings laughter that cannot be stilled. Yet this very thing is the returning elixir, though it often leads men astray under heaven."*

The *Most High* says: *"When inferior men hear the Dao, they laugh greatly. If they did not laugh, it would not be the Dao."*

As *The Awakening to Reality* states: *"The effort is easy, the medicine not distant—revealed, it makes men burst into laughter."* Such is the wondrous principle of the outer elixir.

The Dao of the inner elixir lies in the absence of a single arising thought, in silent inner vigilance, in unwavering constancy day and night. Those of strong will, men of iron spines, through long stillness achieve success. They may project spirit and shed the body, coming and going freely—these are the immortals. Yet among thousands or tens of thousands of modern scholars, scarcely one or two attain this, for it is a Dao easily encountered yet difficult to perfect.

If one cultivates both inner and outer elixirs, refining both nature and life, one must first enter seclusion and sit in stillness, clearly recognizing the Central Palace as the dwelling of body and life. Day and night without sleep, the mind guards within, the heart and kidneys unite in union, and the five qi gather in the Central Palace. After a hundred days of purity, the chaotic elixir head forms, resembling a parrot’s egg—lively and fluid, gathering and dispersing, ascending and descending. It is easily dissipated and difficult to congeal.

Thereafter, one extracts the single point from Kan, the true unity of pure yang elixir, to transmute the yin mercury elixir head within Li, instantly transforming it into a body of pure Qian. Thus, once obtained, it is eternally retained, gathering without scattering. Success is achieved in days, with both form and spirit perfected. There is no need to project spirit or shed the body—one may pierce metal and penetrate stone, perform a thousand transformations and ten thousand changes. Then, sitting in stillness for nine years, one awakens to the nature school, attaining the Dao of heavenly immortals.

**Secret Formula of the Golden Elixir**

The *Book of Changes* says: *"The six hours from Zi to Si form half a celestial cycle."* To perform this most wondrous practice, one moves this water and conducts this fire, also taking baths and ablutions. The count is six days, corresponding to three months. Altogether, the movement of water spans from Wu to Hai, six hours in number.

From Zi to Si, one conducts fire weighing one jin, one liang, and one zhu—twenty-four zhu make one liang, which is one breath. Water is metal-water, also called the wine within the pot. When drawing from the water tripod, it is at the twenty-fourth Si, within the six-hour celestial count. Only two hours are spent in this movement, also within the celestial count, but one must not proceed past Zi. If the hour is misaligned, the medicine will lack efficacy.

If one conducts water and fire in accordance with the hours, harmonizing with the utmost wonder of heaven and earth, not a single thing will go amiss. This fire timing is a secret formula of the highest immortals—it must not be treated lightly! To transmit it to the unworthy invites heavenly retribution.

*Zhang the Perfected One says:* *"Meeting someone yet not transmitting the secret celestial treasure, or transmitting it to the unworthy, is to leak the heavenly Dao. When transmitting, one must ensure the recipient is genuine; reckless transmission brings karmic punishment to seven generations."*

To those without faith, even if surrounded by gold and jade, do not impart this. Moreover, to transmit this Dao, one must preserve essence and nurture qi, accumulate virtuous deeds to save others, honor parents, revere heaven and earth, and repay the king and the land. Thus, success is achieved in days, and one stands shoulder to shoulder with the ancient sages. If one acts recklessly or lightly, dust and obstacles arise, and success is unattainable. But by following this wondrous Dao, ascending to the golden towers of heaven—how could it be difficult?

Through this Dao dwelling within me, I rescue and uplift seven generations of ancestors. The Dao is originally formless, giving birth to heaven and earth; it is originally nameless, and we forcibly call it the Dao. One must reverently guard this secret, for in every place, divine dragons offer protection.

*Zhang the Perfected One says:* *"Transmitting thrice to the unworthy brings three great calamities. If one treats it lightly or leaks it, one will fall into the suffering of Dengdu. Later, those of like mind and love for the Dao should guide one another, that the multitudes may avoid premature death."*

My fate is not decreed by Heaven. The *Luyanzi Secret Formula for Refining and Nurturing* by Yu Shouyi of Western Shu—this formula was already revered as the profound root by the divine immortals of high antiquity. Receive it with reverence and treasure it, that primordial yang may be deeply stored within the Purple Palace, and true essence may ascend to the Original Palace. The key lies in seizing the moment to apply or withdraw, and in fortifying the Seven Gates and sealing the Eight Deviations—truly the essential Dao. If treated lightly or leaked, one will incur the retribution of yin. This is the twenty-eighth transmission of the Purple Radiance Perfected One!

**Ancient Immortal’s Secret Formula**
- Black Dragon’s spine and brain: 24 taels, soaked in fine rice vinegar, then roasted until scorched red and ground to powder.
- Sal ammoniac: half a tael.
- Fennel: half a tael.
- Sour jujube kernels: half a tael, stir-fried and shelled.
- Magnetite: one tael, calcined in fire and quenched in vinegar seven times.
- Stone swallows: three, prepared identically.
- Pumice: two taels, prepared identically.
- Walnut meat: half a tael, stir-fried.
- Lotus seeds: one tael.
- Morinda root: one tael, stir-fried.
- Foxnut seeds: one tael.
- Polygala root: one tael, with hearts removed.
- Cistanche: one tael, soaked in wine.
- Acorus: one tael.

Grind the above into powder. Take twenty-one yellow sparrows, remove their beaks, wings, feathers, feet, and entrails, then boil them in fine wine until pulpy. Discard the bones and mix with the powder to form pills the size of tung seeds. Take thirty pills on an empty stomach, washed down with musk wine. At the critical moment, one may feel as though drawing water through a tube, or like insects crawling from below upward, with heat blazing like fire—this is the sign of efficacy. After five to seven days of ingestion, a natural response will follow. Take again at the appointed time; the formula powerfully seals the essence-chamber, replenishes primordial yang, and when closed, true essence ascends to the Mud Pill Palace, coalescing into a treasure!

The Dao of cultivation and refinement does not depart from the Five Phases and the union of yin and yang. Just as Heaven and Earth do not unite, the myriad things cannot arise; just as the sun and moon do not unite, the waxing, waning, crescents, and fullness of the lunar phases cannot be distinguished.

chunks.original_text: 紫团丹经竟 #1『也』当为『他』之误。 偃月玄金篇序#1 大道未分之时，不能明，不能见。 视之无形，听之无声，谓之渺瞑，乃无象之道也。 大道既判之后，而生太初，五行已分，两仪奠着，日月为魂魄，运五行於天地之间，列阴阳为气候，升降於天地之内。 杵臼二星，见乎南北之源，乃乾坤之卦，会戌亥之间。 日月朔望，阴阳交媾和合，而后万物生焉。 万物禀於亥，而出乎无有，於壬子而发生也。 人同万物而生，皆从天地之门户而出焉。 乾者，天门也； 坤者，地户也，伯阳云：乾坤，易之门户。 人之生也，乾道成男，坤道成女，两情交感而禀其气。 阳精为魂，阴精为魄，两精相搏而神生焉。 是故圣人夺乾坤变化之机权，合男女阴阳之精髓，交日月变化之魂魄，聚五行三元之配类。 所以混一气而合二仪，备三才而通四象，养之神室土釜，五行既具，其物自成。 上古圣人，近世神仙，皆自炼金丹而升天矣。 神室炼养金丹第一 炼金丹须凭乾坤二气，递相制伏，凝结而成大丹。 凡男子真汞，其性慕铅，纵然留住，遇火而飞腾，所以难制伏。 惟得红铅，点其己性，或流散，更得白银已聚之，则凝而不散。 然后烹炼以偃月玄金之炉，浇灌红雪玉膏，加以金水沐浴，得九十日而成阳丹也。 鲍真人云：八月炼头冬．炼尾。 高象先云：大哉！ 九十日功成可证矣！ 炼丹九十日气归，尽变为纯阳。 张浪仙云：金乌没，玉兔生。 高象先云：万物皆因天地生，既成纯阳之体，然后择其生金丹者於已成之后，服一粒，升天必矣！ 叵得圣人高诀已，丹经十万言，一览而晓，所谓一法通而万事毕。 道不远矣！ 采红曾炼为阳丹第二 惟收红雪，烹作白银，真精方住，元阳始结。 炼成阳丹，为之命基，结作玄珠，为长生根蒂。 然后精旺丹田，中有本元之气，通血脉流行。 平叔云：金鼎欲留珠裹汞，玉池先下水中银。 夫红雪产於金鼎月华之中，为之水中金，圣人名至宝。 海蟾云：炼得宝成阳丹足。 平叔云：此般至宝家家有。 绿鼎气血海谓四海辐辏，又名水源，其经脉为海潮已，其来有信也，又名信水，其色赤，曰赤水，曰降气，曰黑铅，能生神而造化，故曰神水。 与太阴同经，一月三十日，周而复始，上下两弦，朔望凡五日，水金生女人信水，一月之问来五次。 水中汞生金则沉而浊，三日之后则浮而清。 清者药也，浊者黑铅也。 阴真君云：黑铅已遇采红铅。 吕公云：辨水源清浊，然后知金木间隔。 平叔云：不识浮沉定主宾。 此其证也。 三日后，第四日、第五日，采浮而清者，红铅也，又名红雪，又名水中金，又名白银。 白银者，乃自黑铅而产出也。 《参同契》云：铅性浮，银性沉。 诀日：当夜半子时，自有霞光照鼎面，满室而明，铅含五彩，发辉於外，则光自照。 海蟾云：回首循环荡，霞光满室生。 吕公云：温温铅鼎，光透帘帏。 紫团真人云：候炉中光气骈阗者，此下手采取药物，择师印正，当时日用法，采之药必成矣！ 采取阴阳真丹第三 夫采取丹药，须已妙在转天关，番地轴，腾倒上下，已龟饮之用意，取之有药，直入绛宫，上朝泥丸宫，化成玄珠。 《阴符经》云：天发杀机，龙蛇起陆； 人发杀机，天地返覆，此之谓也。

**Preface to the Recumbent Moon Mysterious Gold Chapter**

Before the Dao divided, it could not be illuminated or perceived. Invisible to sight, inaudible to hearing, it was called the "dim and obscure"—the formless Dao. After the Dao had separated, the Great Beginning arose; the Five Phases were distinguished, the Two Modes established. The sun and moon became the hun and po, circulating the Five Phases between heaven and earth, arraying yin and yang as qi and seasons, ascending and descending within the cosmos. The pestle and mortar stars appear at the southern and northern sources, forming the hexagrams of Qian and Kun, converging between Xu and Hai. Through the waxing and waning of the sun and moon, yin and yang unite in harmony, and thereafter the myriad things are born. All things receive their endowment at Hai, emerging from non-being, and germinate at Ren and Zi. Humans, born alongside the myriad things, all issue forth from the gateways of heaven and earth. Qian is the gate of heaven; Kun is the door of earth. As Bo Yang said: "Qian and Kun are the gateways of the *Yi*." In human birth, the Dao of Qian forms the male, the Dao of Kun forms the female; the two emotions interact and receive their qi. Yang essence becomes the hun, yin essence becomes the po; when the two essences contend, spirit is born.

Thus, the sage seizes the transformative mechanism of Qian and Kun, harmonizes the essences of male and female, yin and yang, unites the hun and po of the sun and moon’s transformations, and gathers the correspondences of the Five Phases and Three Origins. Thereby, the single qi merges with the Two Modes, the Three Powers are complete, and the Four Images are communicated. Nurtured within the divine chamber’s earthen crucible, once the Five Phases are fully present, the elixir naturally forms. The sages of antiquity and the immortals of recent ages all ascended to heaven by refining the golden elixir.

**First: Refining and Nurturing the Golden Elixir in the Divine Chamber**

To refine the golden elixir, one must rely on the qi of Qian and Kun, mutually restraining and subduing each other, congealing to form the Great Elixir. The true mercury of men naturally yearns for lead; though temporarily retained, it soars when exposed to fire, making it difficult to subdue. Only when red lead is obtained to temper its nature—even if dispersed—can white silver then gather it, causing it to congeal without scattering. Thereafter, it is refined in the Recumbent Moon Mysterious Gold Crucible, irrigated with red snow and jade cream, bathed in golden water, and after ninety days, the yang elixir is achieved. As Immortal Bao said: "Refine the head in the eighth month, the tail in winter." Gao Xiangxian said: "Great indeed! After ninety days, the work is complete and verification possible!" After ninety days of refining, the qi returns, transforming entirely into pure yang. As Zhang Langxian said: "The golden crow sets, the jade hare rises." Gao Xiangxian said: "All things are born of heaven and earth." Once the body of pure yang is achieved, one then selects the golden elixir that has formed, ingests a single grain, and ascension to heaven is assured! Having obtained the sage’s profound secrets, though the elixir canons number a hundred thousand words, one glance suffices for comprehension—what is meant by "mastering one method completes all things." The Dao is not distant!

**Second: Gathering Red Snow to Refine the Yang Elixir**

Only by collecting red snow and refining it into white silver does the true essence stabilize and the original yang begin to coalesce. The refined yang elixir becomes the foundation of life, forming the mysterious pearl as the root of longevity. Thereafter, essence flourishes in the cinnabar field, where the original qi resides, circulating through the blood vessels. As Pingshu said: "The golden crucible seeks to retain mercury within the pearl; the jade pool first receives silver from the water." Red snow is produced within the golden crucible’s moonlight, known as "gold within water," which the sages name the supreme treasure. As Hai Chan said: "Refining yields a sufficiency of yang elixir." Pingshu said: "Such a supreme treasure exists in every household." The green crucible’s qi and blood sea—termed the "confluence of the four seas," also called the "water source"—its meridians are likened to tidal seas, their arrival predictable, hence also called "trustworthy water." Its color is red, called "red water" or "descending qi," also known as "black lead," which generates spirit and engenders transformation, thus called "divine water." Sharing the same meridian as the Greater Yin, it cycles through thirty days, beginning anew, with two crescents and the new and full moons spanning five days. Water and metal generate the woman’s "trustworthy water," arriving five times in a month. Mercury born in water and gold sinks and is turbid; after three days, it floats and becomes clear. The clear is the medicine; the turbid is black lead. As Immortal Yin said: "Black lead has encountered gathered red lead." As Master Lü said: "Discern the clarity and turbidity of the water source, then know the separation between metal and wood." Pingshu said: "Without recognizing floating and sinking, host and guest are undetermined." This is the proof. After three days, on the fourth and fifth days, gather the floating and clear substance—red lead, also called red snow, water-gold, or white silver. White silver is produced from black lead. The *Cantong Qi* states: "Lead’s nature is to float; silver’s nature is to sink." The formula says: At midnight, the hour of Zi, a rosy glow naturally illuminates the crucible’s surface, filling the chamber with light. The lead, containing the five colors, radiates brilliance externally, and the light shines of itself. As Hai Chan said: "Turning the head to follow the cycle, a rosy glow fills the chamber." Master Lü said: "The warm lead crucible’s light penetrates the curtains." The Purple Cluster Immortal said: "When the crucible’s light and qi are replete, this is the moment to gather the medicine. Choose a master to verify the method, follow the daily practice, and the medicine will surely form!"

**Third: Gathering the Yin-Yang True Elixir**

To gather the elixir medicine, one must skillfully turn the heavenly pivot and earthly axle, inverting above and below, employing the intent of the tortoise drinking, so that the gathered medicine directly enters the Crimson Palace, ascending to the Mud Pill Palace, where it transforms into the mysterious pearl. The *Yinfu Jing* states: "When heaven unleashes its killing mechanism, dragons and serpents rise on land; when humans unleash their killing mechanism, heaven and earth overturn." This is what is meant.

chunks.original_text: 海蟾云：是时鼎安甲乙，炉列庚辛，转天关而玉衡停机，卷地轴而六爻共变； 摩泥珠现双林前，捧过天桥，玄牝门开，华池内真龙还接。 昔黄帝游赤城而获玄珠，离明索之不得，盖此道不可见而取也。 后又使罔象索之而得，盖缘绝利一源，无所见，玄珠得於恍惚杳冥之间。 高象先云：玄珠飞到昆仑上，子若得之求罔象。 盖男子真精，谓之太阳流珠，女子降气，谓之太阴玄珠。 若飞走不可拘制，犹言水银遇大火，即化为气而飞，惟得白银制之则住而凝结，如水银遇银则成砂也。 以火养之，即化生金花也。 阴真君云：金花解生天地宝，此之谓也。 夫采红铅之药，谓之传丹，乃是红雪之传也。 或入绛宫，或过三关，直入泥丸，自古上仙圣人，皆口口相传，不留纸笔。 还丹证明诀第四 凡人学道，先识还丹，必成仙矣！ 《奥旨经》云：只恐铅不真，铅真药自成； 只恐汞不正，汞正药必圣。 又曰：采有日，取有时，世人用之而不知。 平叔云：八月十五玩蟾辉，正是金精旺盛时，金精即金丹，既得金丹，可指日成功。 未成之时，只服一粒，便能点化身中阴气，立化纯阳为神仙也。 故女者，坎卦之象，坎中有一阳，谓之坎男，犹如月中有兔。 男子者，离中有一阴爻，谓之离女，如日中有乌也。 平叔云：取将坎位中心实，点化离宫腹内阴。 若得金丹药，服后度千春。 又云：一粒刀圭五彩分，飞丹走入神仙窟。 赵降真云：七返九还功毕后，只餐一粒到仙家。 平叔云：一粒金丹吞入腹，已知我命不由天。 海蟾云：一粒金丹，长生之药，乃成真一之道。 《混元经》云：铅汞相投，神仙可求； 汞铅相迎，道无不成。 鲍真人云：朱砂九转慢成银，误杀几多人。 夫还丹者，用真龙真虎，真铅真汞，和合於交感之宫，后依时日采而饵之，谓之还丹也。 夫人者，是五蕴所化色身，地水火风，四大假合，以气为根，以神为本，以精为基。 不悟宗元，一向沉迷，走失元气，丧坏本元，耗散至宝，仙道不成。 是故圣人明还返，识浮沉，定主宾，辨铅汞，明火候，其道必成矣！ 还返者，乃大丹之首尾也。 九还七返配类和合第五 夫还返者，乃还源返本也，如或成大丹，夺天地之造化，凝水火之精魂，返复往来，而聚大药，贯穿上下，而成金丹。 真一子云：真阴丹水火，调停百日间。 阴真君云：太一阴之气也。 鲍真人云：黄帝拜广成子，得真一之道。 修金液还丹者，先取未用鼎器，身中红铅为丹头，后取已用鼎，身中白银结金华，炼成纯阳。 再投於交感穴，乾宫之内，养胎十月气足。 凡用三周而毕。 《太上隐语》始青之下月与日。 始青二字，人莫能晓。 始者女胎也，青者丹主也。 金液还丹，姹女真铅。 又曰火铅，乃南方正色，真阳之所也。 又曰九转丹砂，又曰朱衣仙子，又曰赫赫金丹，又曰交梨火枣。 遇秋时而结实，故曰秋石。 《混元经》云：红铅为白虎，首经此乐。 人若餐之入腹，熏达肌肤，四肢和畅，三月通灵，修成大道。 三千功满，铅凝汞结，水制火伏，至药乃成。 还丹功就，虽未成仙，可以长生不死矣！ 其法要鼎器圆备，虎龙全无诸病，方可下手。 切要三七已下，信水才清，玄关未闭。 须半夜子时，有以感动，使其神悦气调，然后驱青龙与白虎交媾，少顷用七星剑取之，得入元宫，则还丹不日而成。

Later, he sent Wang Xiang to search, and it was found, for when profit is utterly cut off and nothing is seen, the mysterious pearl emerges in the midst of dim obscurity. Gao Xiangxian said: 'The mysterious pearl flies to Kunlun’s summit—if you would obtain it, seek Wang Xiang.'

The true essence of man is called the Great Yang Flowing Pearl; the descending qi of woman is called the Great Yin Mysterious Pearl. If it flees and cannot be restrained—like mercury meeting great fire, instantly vaporizing and flying away—only when bound by silver does it settle and congeal, as mercury meeting silver becomes cinnabar. Nurtured by fire, it transforms and blooms into golden flowers. The Yin Immortal Lord said: 'Golden flowers give birth to heaven and earth’s treasure'—this is what is meant.

To gather the red lead medicine is called 'transmitting the elixir,' for it is the transmission of red snow. Whether entering the Crimson Palace or passing through the Three Passes to ascend directly to the Mud Pill Palace, since ancient times, immortals and sages have passed this down mouth to mouth, never committing it to paper.

**Fourth: The Verification Formula for the Returned Elixir**

For those who study the Dao, first recognize the returned elixir, and you will surely become an immortal! The *Profound Principles Sutra* states: 'Only fear the lead is not true—if the lead is true, the medicine forms itself; only fear the mercury is not upright—if the mercury is upright, the medicine must be sacred.' It also says: 'There is a day for gathering, a time for taking—people use it yet do not know.'

Pingshu said: 'On the fifteenth of the eighth month, admire the toad’s radiance—this is precisely when the golden essence flourishes. The golden essence is the golden elixir; once obtained, success can be achieved in days.' Before completion, merely ingesting a single grain can instantly transmute the yin qi within the body, transforming it entirely into pure yang to become a divine immortal.

Thus, woman is the image of the Kan trigram, and within Kan lies one yang, called the Kan male—like the rabbit in the moon. Man is the Li trigram, containing one yin line, called the Li female—like the crow in the sun. Pingshu said: 'Take the solid center from the Kan position, transmute the yin within the Li palace. If you obtain the golden elixir medicine, after ingestion, you will traverse a thousand springs.' He also said: 'A single grain of knife-round divides into five colors, the flying elixir enters the immortal’s grotto.'

Zhao Jiangzhen said: 'After the seven returns and nine reversions complete their work, merely consume one grain to reach the immortal’s home.' Pingshu said: 'Swallowing a single grain of golden elixir, I know my fate is no longer ruled by heaven.' Sea Toad said: 'A single grain of golden elixir is the medicine of longevity, the Dao of achieving true unity.'

The *Primal Chaos Sutra* states: 'When lead and mercury unite, immortality can be sought; when mercury and lead meet, the Dao is never unfulfilled.' Master Bao said: 'Cinnabar slowly becomes silver through nine revolutions—how many have been misled to their deaths!'

The returned elixir uses the true dragon and true tiger, true lead and true mercury, harmonizing them within the Palace of Mutual Resonance. Afterward, gather and ingest it according to the proper time and day—this is called the returned elixir.

Humans are the physical form transformed by the five aggregates, a temporary union of earth, water, fire, and wind, with qi as the root, spirit as the foundation, and essence as the base. Failing to awaken to the primal source, one remains deluded, losing original qi, damaging the fundamental essence, dissipating the supreme treasure, and thus failing to achieve the immortal Dao. Therefore, the sage clarifies the return, discerns ascent and descent, establishes host and guest, distinguishes lead and mercury, and illuminates the fire times—thus the Dao is surely accomplished!

The return is the beginning and end of the great elixir.

**Fifth: The Nine Returns and Seven Reversions—Matching and Harmonizing Categories**

The return is the return to the source, the reversion to the origin. If the great elixir is accomplished, it seizes heaven and earth’s creative power, condenses water and fire’s essence and spirit, cycles back and forth to gather the great medicine, and penetrates above and below to form the golden elixir.

Master True Unity said: 'The true yin elixir, water and fire, harmonize within a hundred days.' The Yin Immortal Lord said: 'This is the qi of Great Unity Yin.' Master Bao said: 'The Yellow Emperor, bowing to Guangchengzi, obtained the Dao of true unity.'

To refine the golden liquid returned elixir, first take the unused crucible, with the red lead within the body as the elixir’s head. Then take the used crucible, where the white silver within the body congeals into golden flowers, refining them into pure yang. Reintroduce it into the Palace of Mutual Resonance, within the Qian palace, and nurture the embryo for ten months until the qi is full. The process is complete after three cycles.

The *Supreme Hidden Sayings* begins: 'Beneath the beginning green, the moon and the sun...' The two characters 'beginning green' are incomprehensible to people. 'Beginning' refers to the female embryo; 'green' is the master of the elixir. The golden liquid returned elixir is the true lead of the alchemical maiden. It is also called fire lead, the true yang of the southern direction’s correct color. It is also called nine-revolved cinnabar, the Scarlet-Clad Immortal, the Radiant Golden Elixir, or the fire pear and burning jujube. It ripens in autumn, hence called autumn stone.

The *Primal Chaos Sutra* states: 'Red lead is the white tiger—first experience this joy. If one ingests it into the abdomen, it permeates the skin and flesh, harmonizing the four limbs. After three months, spiritual communication is achieved, and the great Dao is cultivated. When three thousand merits are fulfilled, lead congeals and mercury solidifies; water restrains fire and fire is subdued—then the supreme medicine is complete. Though the returned elixir’s work is accomplished and immortality is not yet achieved, one can attain longevity and avoid death!

The method requires the crucible to be perfectly prepared, the tiger and dragon free of all ailments before proceeding. It is crucial that the woman be under twenty-one, her menstrual water just cleared, and the mysterious pass not yet closed. At midnight, the hour of zi, when arousal occurs, ensure her spirit is joyful and qi harmonized. Then drive the green dragon to mate with the white tiger. After a moment, use the Seven-Star Sword to gather it, entering the original palace—thus the returned elixir will form in days."

chunks.original_text: 玄珠白膏，元气盛而筋骨壮，与少年无异。 许真人云：白虎才离玉洞门，赤龙跳出真珠海。 壮元阳，如饮琼浆，古仙名为天酒。 又日绛酒，又曰水中金，又曰金华。 其物能结成珠，为天地之宝，故曰玄珠。 人若服之，寿固天地，故曰王母仙桃，又曰生气返魂丹，又曰紫金丹，其芽得真土而生，谓之黄芽。 黄芽者，天地中和之气，太一运合，七曜九宫，生聚神全而成，故曰阴阳根蒂。 逍遥子云：捉得金精作命基，吕公云：当时自饮刀圭者，聚丹之法，后世神仙因时立名，故曰刀圭。 传真人云：刀圭一粒丹，藏在室姬边，大如石榴子，样似琥珀鲜。 取时须至洁，采日要心坚，吞下延年药，功名录上天。 取丹得之顷刻问。 逍遥子云：赫赫金丹一日成，平叔云：一时辰内管丹成。 其刀圭在下丹田之外，玄门之内，一寸三分。 其丹有红脉一条，上牵於心，下贴小肠。 取丹时，必须用意取之，以物引之，就而逆之，如得活捉生吞。 锺离云：推倒玉葫芦，迸出金玛瑙，活捉将来和壳吞。 又曰：捉取龟蛇颠倒吸，《悟世歌》云：驱作赤龙头，猛把骊珠吸。 古圣云：未服金丹，先服还丹，亦不妨也。 太上经云：红铅黑汞大丹头。 铅者，诧女之真铅也。 黑铅者，女子之真铅也。 先服还丹，后服金丹者，是谓将红入黑也。 故药两般总成玄，火龙变化成神仙。 还丹之法，妙在七星剑诀中，其下手诀法，在师口亲传。 红铅黑汞作丹头第六 夫炼金丹还丹法者，全在《混元经》中，又复得真师指诀，不遇真师，修炼难成。 《混元经》云：混沌未判，元气已分。 则一物分为二象，二象者，阴阳也。 阳气上升於天，阴气下降於地，其中则人生焉！ 人生则男女别。 凡炼金液还丹，先须取男汞女铅，养而成丹，二气再合为一，犹如混沌未判之先，刀圭配合，遂成还丹。 若服一粒，寿同天地。 庄子云：凿破混沌，擘裂鸿蒙。 古圣人云：造丹者，从二从八从一。 其法以铅汞各八两，二者合为一斤，成丹字也。 盖二八者，阴也； 一者，阳也。 自二八以上，二十以下，调之为炉鼎，养之为火候。 其法也，候信水才清，玄关未闭，青龙於神室中，与白虎交媾，阳精入於龙宫，即成丹结胎也。 怀之十月，勿令丹母受劳苦，当用心安体泰，丹无不成。 十月满足，有时日，紫河车自降也。 七日之后，其丹从上宫左而出，以脱丹之法取。 法用香汤沐浴，上坛礼谢三清上帝，十极高真，太一真人。 毕，然后服之。 其仪式具在《混元经》下卷，谓之龙虎篇。 世人莫晓，既服之后，换骨化肠为筋，神清精固，阴气消尽，阳气凝真，乃为纯阳之仙。 吕公称为纯阳真人，赵真人云：不识阳中物，谓一者，在二八之中也。 二八者，二八之女子，身中隐真一之道，其一隐於玄关，盖如女人与太阴同经时行，乃一月一周天。 故烟萝子云：三日庚生户闭，金生於水，至於上弦半明，十五日、十六日，金精壮盛，魂魄圆满。 谕女子十五十六时，天癸至，阴精盛也。 世人言上弦初七八，下弦廿二三，自上至下，定其数为十六也。 鲍真人云：二八垣娥更温柔，平叔云：月才天际半轮明，早有龙吟虎啸声。 便好用心修二八，一时辰内管丹成。 又云：前弦之后后弦前，药味平平气象全。

The Mysterious Pearl and White Paste—when primordial qi flourishes, sinews and bones grow strong, no different from youth. Master Xu the Perfected says: "As the White Tiger just departs the Jade Grotto’s gate, the Crimson Dragon leaps from the True Pearl Sea." It fortifies primordial yang, like drinking nectar of jade—ancient immortals called it "Heavenly Wine," also "Crimson Wine," "Gold in Water," or "Golden Flower." This substance can congeal into pearls, a treasure of Heaven and Earth, hence called the Mysterious Pearl. If one ingests it, life endures as long as Heaven and Earth—thus it is also named the Queen Mother’s Immortal Peach, the Life-Restoring Elixir of Returned Soul, or the Purple Gold Elixir. Its sprout, born of true earth, is called the Yellow Sprout. The Yellow Sprout is the harmonious qi of Heaven and Earth, the Great Unity’s revolving convergence, where the Seven Luminaries and Nine Palaces gather and spirit coalesces—hence it is the root and stem of yin and yang.

Master Xiaoyao says: "Seize the golden essence to lay the foundation of life." Master Lü says: "Those who drank the *daogui* in that moment"—the method of elixir-gathering—later immortals named it *daogui* according to the times. Master Chuan the Perfected says:
*"A single grain of daogui,
Hidden beside the chambered maiden,
Large as a pomegranate seed,
Resplendent like fresh amber.
Gather it with utmost purity,
Harvest it with steadfast heart.
Swallow the age-extending medicine,
And your merit shall be recorded in Heaven."*

The elixir is obtained in an instant. Master Xiaoyao says: "The radiant golden elixir forms in a day." Master Pingshu says: "The elixir is complete within one *shichen*." The *daogui* lies outside the lower cinnabar field, within the Mysterious Gate, one *cun* and three *fen*. The elixir bears a crimson vein, ascending to the heart above and adhering to the small intestine below. When gathering it, one must concentrate the intent, draw it with an implement, and seize it in reverse—like capturing it alive to swallow whole. Master Zhongli says: "Tilt the jade gourd, and golden agate bursts forth—seize it alive and swallow it whole." It is also said: "Capture the tortoise and serpent, then reverse and inhale." The *Awakening the World Song* says: "Drive it to become the Crimson Dragon’s head, fiercely snatch the Black Pearl to absorb." The ancient sages said: "Before ingesting the golden elixir, first take the returned elixir—this is not amiss."

The *Scripture of the Great Ultimate* says: "Red lead and black mercury are the great elixir’s foundation." Lead is the true lead of the chaste maiden; black lead is the true lead of the woman. Taking the returned elixir before the golden elixir means introducing the red into the black. Thus, the two medicines together form the Mysterious, and the Fire Dragon transforms into a divine immortal.

The method of the returned elixir lies hidden within the Seven-Star Sword’s secrets; the oral instructions for its execution must be personally transmitted by a master. **Red Lead and Black Mercury as the Elixir’s Foundation, Sixth Chapter**

The method for refining the golden elixir and returned elixir is fully contained within the *Scripture of Primordial Chaos*. Yet one must also receive the true master’s oral instructions—without encountering a true master, cultivation is difficult to accomplish. The *Scripture of Primordial Chaos* says: "Before the primordial chaos divided, primordial qi was already distinct." Thus, one thing split into two images—these two images are yin and yang. Yang qi ascends to Heaven, yin qi descends to Earth, and between them, humans are born! From human birth, male and female diverge.

In refining the golden liquid and returned elixir, one must first gather the man’s mercury and woman’s lead, nurture them into an elixir, and recombine the two qi into one—just as before the primordial chaos divided. The *daogui* unites, and the returned elixir is thus formed. If one ingests a single grain, life endures as long as Heaven and Earth. Zhuangzi said: "Split the primordial chaos, rend the vast mist." The ancient sages said: "To forge the elixir, begin with two, then eight, then one." The method uses eight ounces each of lead and mercury, combining the two into one *jin*—forming the character for "elixir." Here, two and eight are yin; one is yang. From eighteen to twenty years of age, regulate them as the crucible and furnace, nurture them as the fire and timing.

The method requires waiting until the menstrual water has just cleared and the Mysterious Pass remains unsealed. The Green Dragon in the spirit chamber mates with the White Tiger, and yang essence enters the Dragon Palace—then the elixir forms and the embryo congeals. Nurture it for ten months, ensuring the elixir mother does not endure hardship; maintain a calm mind and peaceful body, and the elixir will surely form. After ten months, when the time arrives, the Purple River Chariot descends of its own accord. Seven days later, the elixir emerges from the upper palace on the left—retrieve it using the method of elixir extraction. First, bathe in fragrant water, ascend the altar, and pay homage to the Three Pure Ones, the Ten Loftiest Perfected, and the Perfected of the Great Unity. Afterward, ingest the elixir. The rituals are fully detailed in the lower scroll of the *Scripture of Primordial Chaos*, in the chapter titled "Dragon and Tiger."

Few in the world understand: after ingestion, bones are replaced and intestines transformed into sinews; spirit becomes clear, essence solidifies, yin qi dissipates entirely, and yang qi congeals into truth—thus one becomes a pure yang immortal. Master Lü was called the Perfected of Pure Yang. Master Zhao said: "Those who do not recognize the thing within yang refer to the One within the two and eight." The two and eight are the woman of eighteen, within whose body the true Way of the One is concealed. The One lies hidden within the Mysterious Pass—like a woman’s alignment with the Great Yin during her monthly cycle, completing one revolution of Heaven each month.

Thus, Master Yanluo said: "On the third day, when *geng* is born, the gate closes—metal is born of water. By the first quarter, half-bright; on the fifteenth and sixteenth days, the metal essence flourishes, and soul and spirit become whole." This alludes to the woman at fifteen or sixteen, when heavenly water arrives and yin essence flourishes. The world says: the first quarter on the seventh or eighth day, the last quarter on the twenty-second or twenty-third—from top to bottom, the number is fixed at sixteen. Master Bao said: "The eighteen-year-old maiden is even more tender." Master Pingshu said: "When the moon is but a half-wheel at the sky’s edge, the dragon’s roar and tiger’s howl are already heard. Then focus the mind to cultivate the two and eight—the elixir will form within one *shichen*." chunks.original_text: 探得归来炉裹缎，想时温养自烹鲜。 取丹用八月十五日夜，风清月白，此乃是金精壮盛之时。 当夜半子时，阳生之初也。 高象先云：采有时，取有日，采兮取兮须谨密，莫使骊龙惊觉来，天真丧尽玄珠失。 采有日，取有时，世人用之而不知。 自古神仙达士，皆因炼养金液还丹而成。 恐泄天机，托名外丹。 后学不知，只求外丹烧铅汞，以望成仙，不亦远乎！ 高象先云：世人不识真阴阳，茫茫天下寻龙虎。 平叔云：休泥丹灶费工夫，炼药须凭偃月炉。 炉者，金丹之匡郭，后学乃以偃月炉有上下弦时，可以取药，错甚矣！ 高象先云：但得寻偃月炉，予不避天谴，使后学明修丹之要，着于后。 偃月炉养丹火候第七 养丹火候之诀：炉在身中交感宫。 《混元经》云：白虎元宫，纯阳之所，故日乾宫。 能使太一含真气，故曰太一宫。

chunks.original_text: 白银於此而生，故曰水银坑。 玉洞之中，化生金华，故曰金室。 真土之所处，故曰土釜，又曰戊己门。 金丹从此而生，养之乃成变化，故曰神室。 其池生水，故曰华池，又曰神水，又曰紫府门。 门中有三山，左山名甲山，山中有门，名曰甲门。 右山名己山，山中有门，名曰己门。 门中有山，名紫金山。 紫河车从此而出，水之源也，其物自甲山甲门而出者，曰希夷路，曰三华路，曰白雪路，曰乌飞路。 自己山己门而出者，曰曲江路，曰五彩路，曰黄芽路。 吕公云：曲江上，见月华莹净，有个乌飞是也。 盖缘甲己土者，乃真土也。 平叔云四象交加戊己中，高象先云莫若先敲戊己门，以其神室土釜，乃真土也。 甲己真土，又得神室土釜，二土合为刀圭。 世人不知女子水宫，与太阴月华同经而行，度数亦五日一候也。 凡一月六候，三甲己也，遇甲日则甲门开，遇己日则己门开，遇二合日则紫府门开，乃信行也，此五日之候也。 高象先曰：奇哉！ 三十辐共一毂，乾坤造化时，阴阳交五六。 五者五日一候，六者一月六候。 修丹之士，火侯最难。 平叔云不将火候着於文，青霞子云六百篇中无限事，岂教容易泄天机。 大凡火候在甲己六日之中，半夜子时，遇甲日即右偃其炉，取左门之气； 遇己日即左偃其炉，取右门之气。 自古神仙宝秘，不露此说，不彰此法，第名偃月炉。 平叔云：偃月炉中玉蕊生，凡温养之法，其要在防危虑险也。 吕公云：进火工夫牛斗危，平叔云抽添运用却防危，《阴符》云：火生於木，祸发必克也。 切忌之！ 以此为戒。

Herein silver is born, thus called the Cinnabar Pit.
Within the Jade Grotto, golden blossoms transform and arise—
thus called the Golden Chamber.
Where true earth abides,
it is called the Earth Cauldron, or the Gate of *Wu-Ji*.
The golden elixir is born here,
nurtured to achieve transmutation—
thus called the Spirit Chamber.

thus called the Flowery Pond,
or Spirit Water,
or the Gate of the Purple Palace.
